# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
import { db } from '@/src/db';
import { todos } from '@/src/db/schema';
import type { NewTodo } from '@/src/db/schema';

describe('Todo Integration Tests', () => {
  // Clean up test data before all tests
  beforeAll(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  // Clean up test data after all tests
  afterAll(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  it('should add a todo to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new todo object
    const newTodo: NewTodo = {
      title: 'Test Todo',
      description: 'This is a test todo item',
      completed: false,
    };

    // Act: Insert the todo into the database
    const insertedTodos = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodo).returning();
    const insertedTodo = insertedTodos[0];

    // Assert: Verify the todo was inserted with correct data
    expect(insertedTodo).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedTodo.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedTodo.title).toBe('Test Todo');
    expect(insertedTodo.description).toBe('This is a test todo item');
    expect(insertedTodo.completed).toBe(false);
    expect(insertedTodo.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedTodo.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the todo back from the database
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));
    const queriedTodo = queriedTodos[0];

    // Assert: Verify the queried todo matches the inserted todo
    expect(queriedTodo).toBeDefined();
    expect(queriedTodo.id).toBe(insertedTodo.id);
    expect(queriedTodo.title).toBe(insertedTodo.title);
    expect(queriedTodo.description).toBe(insertedTodo.description);
    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(insertedTodo.completed);
    expect(queriedTodo.createdAt.getTime()).toBe(insertedTodo.createdAt.getTime());
    expect(queriedTodo.updatedAt.getTime()).toBe(insertedTodo.updatedAt.getTime());
  });

  it('should insert multiple todos and query all of them', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple todo objects
    const newTodos: NewTodo[] = [
      { title: 'First Todo', description: 'First test todo', completed: false },
      { title: 'Second Todo', description: 'Second test todo', completed: true },
      { title: 'Third Todo', completed: false },
    ];

    // Act: Insert multiple todos
    const insertedTodos = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodos).returning();

    // Assert: Verify all todos were inserted
    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(insertedTodos[0].title).toBe('First Todo');
    expect(insertedTodos[1].title).toBe('Second Todo');
    expect(insertedTodos[2].title).toBe('Third Todo');

    // Act: Query all todos
    const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

    // Assert: Verify we can retrieve all todos
    expect(allTodos.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(3);
  });

  it('should query todos by completed status', async () => {
    // Act: Query only completed todos
    const completedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.completed, true));

    // Assert: Verify only completed todos are returned
    expect(completedTodos.length).toBeGreaterThan(0);
    completedTodos.forEach((todo) => {
      expect(todo.completed).toBe(true);
    });
  });

  it('should update a todo and verify the changes', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a new todo
    const newTodo: NewTodo = {
      title: 'Todo to Update',
      description: 'This will be updated',
      completed: false,
    };
    const [insertedTodo] = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodo).returning();

    // Act: Update the todo
    const [updatedTodo] = await db
      .update(todos)
      .set({ completed: true, description: 'Updated description' })
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the todo was updated
    expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(updatedTodo.description).toBe('Updated description');

    // Act: Query the updated todo
    const [queriedTodo] = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the changes persisted
    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(queriedTodo.description).toBe('Updated description');
  });

  it('should delete a todo from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a new todo
    const newTodo: NewTodo = {
      title: 'Todo to Delete',
      completed: false,
    };
    const [insertedTodo] = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodo).returning();

    // Act: Delete the todo
    await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the todo was deleted
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));
    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(0);
  });
});

## ✅ What's Been Set Up

### 1. **Database & ORM Setup**
- **Neon Database**: Created a new Neon project called "todo-app" (Project ID: `bold-tooth-81748345`)
- **Drizzle ORM**: Installed and configured with the Neon serverless driver
- **Connection String**: Stored in `.env.local` for secure access

### 2. **Database Schema** (`src/db/schema.ts`)
Created a comprehensive `todos` table with:
- `id` - Auto-incrementing primary key
- `title` - Required text field
- `description` - Optional text field
- `completed` - Boolean flag (defaults to false)
- `createdAt` - Automatic timestamp on creation
- `updatedAt` - Automatic timestamp on updates

### 3. **Database Connection** (`src/db/index.ts`)
- Configured Drizzle with Neon's serverless connection pool
- Exported typed database instance for use throughout the app

### 4. **Integration Tests** (`__tests__/todo.integration.test.ts`)
Created 5 comprehensive tests using Drizzle syntax:

✅ **Test 1**: Add a todo and query it back successfully
- Inserts a new todo with title, description, and completed status
- Verifies all fields including timestamps
- Queries the todo back by ID and validates data integrity

✅ **Test 2**: Insert multiple todos and query all
- Batch inserts 3 todos with different properties
- Verifies all todos are inserted correctly
- Queries all todos from the database

✅ **Test 3**: Query todos by completed status
- Filters todos using Drizzle's `where` clause
- Validates only completed todos are returned

✅ **Test 4**: Update a todo and verify changes
- Updates a todo's completed status and description
- Verifies changes persist in the database

✅ **Test 5**: Delete a todo
- Removes a todo from the database
- Confirms the todo no longer exists

### 5. **Test Results**
```
✓ All 5 tests passed successfully in 2.5 seconds
✓ Real database operations against Neon
✓ Full CRUD operations tested (Create, Read, Update, Delete)
```

```

└── .env.local             # Database connection string
```

## 🚀 Running the Tests
```bash
npm test
```

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

  id: serial('id').primaryKey(),
  title: text('title').notNull(),
  description: text('description'),
  completed: boolean('completed').notNull().default(false),
  createdAt: timestamp('created_at').notNull().defaultNow(),
  updatedAt: timestamp('updated_at').notNull().defaultNow(),
});

export type Todo = typeof todos.$inferSelect;
export type NewTodo = typeof todos.$inferInsert;

import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos, type NewTodo } from '@/db/schema';

describe('Todo Integration Tests', () => {
  // Clean up after each test
  afterEach(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  describe('Add and Query Todo', () => {
    it('should successfully add a todo to the database and query it back', async () => {
      // Arrange: Create a new todo
      const newTodo: NewTodo = {
        title: 'Test Todo',
        description: 'This is a test todo item',
        completed: false,
      };

      // Act: Insert the todo
      const [insertedTodo] = await db
        .insert(todos)
        .values(newTodo)
        .returning();

      // Assert: Verify the inserted todo
      expect(insertedTodo).toBeDefined();
      expect(insertedTodo.id).toBeTypeOf('number');
      expect(insertedTodo.title).toBe(newTodo.title);
      expect(insertedTodo.description).toBe(newTodo.description);
      expect(insertedTodo.completed).toBe(false);
      expect(insertedTodo.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
      expect(insertedTodo.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

      // Act: Query the todo back from the database
      const queriedTodos = await db
        .select()
        .from(todos)
        .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

      // Assert: Verify the queried todo matches
      expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
      expect(queriedTodos[0]).toEqual(insertedTodo);
      expect(queriedTodos[0].title).toBe(newTodo.title);
      expect(queriedTodos[0].description).toBe(newTodo.description);
    });

    it('should add multiple todos and query them all', async () => {
      // Arrange: Create multiple todos
      const todosToInsert: NewTodo[] = [
        { title: 'First Todo', description: 'First description', completed: false },
        { title: 'Second Todo', description: 'Second description', completed: true },
        { title: 'Third Todo', description: null, completed: false },
      ];

      // Act: Insert multiple todos
      const insertedTodos = await db
        .insert(todos)
        .values(todosToInsert)
        .returning();

      // Assert: Verify all todos were inserted
      expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(3);

      // Act: Query all todos
      const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

      // Assert: Verify all todos are returned
      expect(allTodos).toHaveLength(3);
      expect(allTodos[0].title).toBe('First Todo');
      expect(allTodos[1].title).toBe('Second Todo');
      expect(allTodos[2].title).toBe('Third Todo');
      expect(allTodos[2].description).toBeNull();
    });

    it('should query todos by completed status', async () => {
      // Arrange: Add completed and incomplete todos
      await db.insert(todos).values([
        { title: 'Completed Todo', completed: true },
        { title: 'Incomplete Todo', completed: false },
        { title: 'Another Completed', completed: true },
      ]);

      // Act: Query only completed todos
      const completedTodos = await db
        .select()
        .from(todos)
        .where(eq(todos.completed, true));

      // Assert: Verify only completed todos are returned
      expect(completedTodos).toHaveLength(2);
      expect(completedTodos.every(todo => todo.completed)).toBe(true);
    });

    it('should update a todo and query the updated version', async () => {
      // Arrange: Insert a todo
      const [insertedTodo] = await db
        .insert(todos)
        .values({
          title: 'Original Title',
          description: 'Original Description',
          completed: false,
        })
        .returning();

      // Act: Update the todo
      const [updatedTodo] = await db
        .update(todos)
        .set({
          title: 'Updated Title',
          completed: true,
          updatedAt: new Date(),
        })
        .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
        .returning();

      // Assert: Verify the update
      expect(updatedTodo.title).toBe('Updated Title');
      expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
      expect(updatedTodo.description).toBe('Original Description');

      // Act: Query the updated todo
      const [queriedTodo] = await db
        .select()
        .from(todos)
        .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

      // Assert: Verify the queried todo has the updates
      expect(queriedTodo.title).toBe('Updated Title');
      expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    });

    it('should delete a todo and verify it is removed', async () => {
      // Arrange: Insert a todo
      const [insertedTodo] = await db
        .insert(todos)
        .values({
          title: 'Todo to Delete',
          completed: false,
        })
        .returning();

      // Act: Delete the todo
      await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

      // Assert: Verify the todo is deleted
      const queriedTodos = await db
        .select()
        .from(todos)
        .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

      expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(0);
    });

    it('should handle todos without description', async () => {
      // Arrange & Act: Insert a todo without description
      const [insertedTodo] = await db
        .insert(todos)
        .values({
          title: 'Todo without description',
          completed: false,
        })
        .returning();

      // Assert: Verify description is null
      expect(insertedTodo.description).toBeNull();

      // Act: Query the todo
      const [queriedTodo] = await db
        .select()
        .from(todos)
        .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

      // Assert: Verify queried todo also has null description
      expect(queriedTodo.description).toBeNull();
    });
  });
});

## Summary

### 1. **Database Setup**
- Created a new Neon project called "todo-app"
- Configured the connection string in `.env.local`

### 2. **Drizzle ORM Integration**
- Installed `drizzle-orm`, `@neondatabase/serverless`, and `drizzle-kit`
- Created a `todos` table schema with:
  - `id` (serial primary key)
  - `title` (required text)
  - `description` (optional text)
  - `completed` (boolean, defaults to false)
  - `createdAt` and `updatedAt` timestamps
- Configured Drizzle and pushed the schema to the database

### 3. **Integration Tests**
Created a comprehensive test suite in `__tests__/todo.integration.test.ts` that verifies:

✅ **Basic CRUD Operations:**
- Adding a todo and querying it back
- Adding multiple todos
- Querying todos by status (completed/incomplete)
- Updating todos
- Deleting todos
- Handling optional fields (null descriptions)

All **6 tests passed successfully**! The tests use Drizzle's query syntax (`db.insert()`, `db.select()`, `db.update()`, `db.delete()`) and verify that:
- Todos are correctly inserted with all fields
- Data can be queried back accurately
- Updates persist correctly
- Deletions work as expected
- Optional fields are handled properly

The integration tests run against the actual Neon database, providing real-world validation of your database operations."}],"stop_reason":null,"stop_sequence":null,"usage":{"input_tokens":0,"cache_creation_input_tokens":315,"cache_read_input_tokens":40727,"cache_creation":{"ephemeral_5m_input_tokens":315,"ephemeral_1h_input_tokens":0},"output_tokens":13,"service_tier":"standard"}},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"98e7b025-c7cf-4835-8d10-9e0444439d89","uuid":"39637d4d-f658-4647-9055-583d9405d9cc"},{"type":"result","subtype":"success","is_error":false,"duration_ms":187638,"duration_api_ms":171290,"num_turns":86,"result":"Excellent! # Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('Todo Integration Tests', () => {
  // Clean up todos before each test
  beforeEach(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  it('should add a todo to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new todo
    const newTodo = {
      title: 'Test Todo',
      description: 'This is a test todo',
      completed: false,
    };

    // Act: Insert the todo into the database
    const [insertedTodo] = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodo).returning();

    // Assert: Check that the todo was inserted with correct values
    expect(insertedTodo).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedTodo.id).toBeTypeOf('number');
    expect(insertedTodo.title).toBe(newTodo.title);
    expect(insertedTodo.description).toBe(newTodo.description);
    expect(insertedTodo.completed).toBe(newTodo.completed);
    expect(insertedTodo.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedTodo.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the todo back from the database
    const queriedTodos = await db.select().from(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the queried todo matches the inserted todo
    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(queriedTodos[0].id).toBe(insertedTodo.id);
    expect(queriedTodos[0].title).toBe(newTodo.title);
    expect(queriedTodos[0].description).toBe(newTodo.description);
    expect(queriedTodos[0].completed).toBe(newTodo.completed);
  });

  it('should create multiple todos and query all of them', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple todos
    const todosToInsert = [
      { title: 'Todo 1', description: 'First todo', completed: false },
      { title: 'Todo 2', description: 'Second todo', completed: true },
      { title: 'Todo 3', description: 'Third todo', completed: false },
    ];

    // Act: Insert multiple todos
    const insertedTodos = await db.insert(todos).values(todosToInsert).returning();

    // Assert: Check that all todos were inserted
    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(3);

    // Act: Query all todos
    const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

    // Assert: Verify all todos are in the database
    expect(allTodos).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(allTodos[0].title).toBe('Todo 1');
    expect(allTodos[1].title).toBe('Todo 2');
    expect(allTodos[2].title).toBe('Todo 3');
  });

  it('should update a todo and verify the changes', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({
        title: 'Original Todo',
        description: 'Original description',
        completed: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the todo
    const [updatedTodo] = await db
      .update(todos)
      .set({
        title: 'Updated Todo',
        completed: true,
      })
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the update
    expect(updatedTodo.title).toBe('Updated Todo');
    expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(updatedTodo.description).toBe('Original description');

    // Act: Query the updated todo
    const [queriedTodo] = await db.select().from(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the changes persisted
    expect(queriedTodo.title).toBe('Updated Todo');
    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
  });

  it('should delete a todo from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({
        title: 'Todo to Delete',
        description: 'This will be deleted',
        completed: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Delete the todo
    await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the todo is deleted
    const queriedTodos = await db.select().from(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));
    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  it('should query todos by completed status', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create todos with different statuses
    await db.insert(todos).values([
      { title: 'Completed Todo 1', description: 'Done', completed: true },
      { title: 'Incomplete Todo', description: 'Not done', completed: false },
      { title: 'Completed Todo 2', description: 'Done', completed: true },
    ]);

    // Act: Query only completed todos
    const completedTodos = await db.select().from(todos).where(eq(todos.completed, true));

    // Assert: Verify only completed todos are returned
    expect(completedTodos).toHaveLength(2);
    expect(completedTodos.every(todo => todo.completed)).toBe(true);

    // Act: Query only incomplete todos
    const incompleteTodos = await db.select().from(todos).where(eq(todos.completed, false));

    // Assert: Verify only incomplete todos are returned
    expect(incompleteTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(incompleteTodos[0].completed).toBe(false);
  });
});

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('Todo Integration Tests', () => {
  // Clean up before each test
  beforeEach(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  it('should add a todo to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new todo
    const newTodo = {
      title: 'Buy groceries',
      completed: false,
    };

    // Act: Insert the todo into the database
    const insertedTodos = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodo).returning();

    // Assert: Verify the todo was inserted
    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(insertedTodos[0]).toMatchObject({
      title: 'Buy groceries',
      completed: false,
    });
    expect(insertedTodos[0].id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedTodos[0].createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedTodos[0].updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the todo back from the database
    const queriedTodos = await db.select().from(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodos[0].id));

    // Assert: Verify the queried todo matches the inserted todo
    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(queriedTodos[0]).toEqual(insertedTodos[0]);
  });

  it('should add multiple todos and query them all', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple todos
    const newTodos = [
      { title: 'Buy groceries', completed: false },
      { title: 'Walk the dog', completed: true },
      { title: 'Write tests', completed: false },
    ];

    // Act: Insert multiple todos
    await db.insert(todos).values(newTodos);

    // Act: Query all todos
    const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

    // Assert: Verify all todos were inserted
    expect(allTodos).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(allTodos[0].title).toBe('Buy groceries');
    expect(allTodos[1].title).toBe('Walk the dog');
    expect(allTodos[2].title).toBe('Write tests');
  });

  it('should update a todo', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db.insert(todos).values({
      title: 'Incomplete task',
      completed: false,
    }).returning();

    // Act: Update the todo
    const [updatedTodo] = await db
      .update(todos)
      .set({ completed: true })
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the todo was updated
    expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(updatedTodo.title).toBe('Incomplete task');
  });

  it('should delete a todo', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db.insert(todos).values({
      title: 'Task to delete',
      completed: false,
    }).returning();

    // Act: Delete the todo
    await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Act: Try to query the deleted todo
    const deletedTodos = await db.select().from(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the todo was deleted
    expect(deletedTodos).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  it('should filter completed todos', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert todos with different completion states
    await db.insert(todos).values([
      { title: 'Completed task 1', completed: true },
      { title: 'Incomplete task', completed: false },
      { title: 'Completed task 2', completed: true },
    ]);

    // Act: Query only completed todos
    const completedTodos = await db.select().from(todos).where(eq(todos.completed, true));

    // Assert: Verify only completed todos were returned
    expect(completedTodos).toHaveLength(2);
    expect(completedTodos.every(todo => todo.completed)).toBe(true);
  });
});

## 🎉 Summary

- `db.insert(todos).values(...).returning()` for insertions
- `db.select().from(todos).where(...)` for queries
- `db.update(todos).set(...).where(...).returning()` for updates

I've successfully built a todo application with Neon and Drizzle, complete with comprehensive integration tests. Here's what was created:

## 🎉 Summary

### What's Been Set Up:

1. **Neon Database**: Created a new Neon project called "todo-app" with credentials stored in `.env.local`

2. **Drizzle ORM**: 
   - Installed `drizzle-orm`, `@neondatabase/serverless`, and `drizzle-kit`
   - Created database schema (`db/schema.ts`) with a `todos` table featuring:
     - `id` (serial primary key)
     - `title` (text, required)
     - `completed` (boolean, defaults to false)
     - `createdAt` and `updatedAt` timestamps
   - Configured Drizzle with Neon HTTP connection (`db/index.ts`)
   - Generated and pushed migrations to the database

3. **Integration Tests**: Created comprehensive tests in `__tests__/todos.integration.test.ts` that verify:
   - ✅ Adding a todo and querying it back successfully
   - ✅ Adding multiple todos and querying them all
   - ✅ Updating a todo's completion status
   - ✅ Deleting a todo
   - ✅ Filtering todos by completion status

### Test Results:
All **5 tests passed** successfully! 🎊

The integration tests use proper Drizzle syntax including:
- `db.insert(todos).values(...).returning()` for insertions
- `db.select().from(todos).where(...)` for queries
- `db.update(todos).set(...).where(...).returning()` for updates
- `db.delete(todos).where(...)` for deletions
- `eq()` helper for equality comparisons

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

  id: serial('id').primaryKey(),
  title: text('title').notNull(),
  description: text('description'),
  completed: boolean('completed').default(false).notNull(),
  createdAt: timestamp('created_at').defaultNow().notNull(),
  updatedAt: timestamp('updated_at').defaultNow().notNull(),
});

export type Todo = typeof todos.$inferSelect;
export type NewTodo = typeof todos.$inferInsert;

import { describe, it, expect, beforeAll, afterEach } from 'vitest';
import { db } from '@/src/db';
import { todos } from '@/src/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
import * as dotenv from 'dotenv';

// Load environment variables
dotenv.config({ path: '.env.local' });

describe('Todo Database Integration Tests', () => {
  beforeAll(async () => {
    // Verify database connection is available
    if (!process.env.DATABASE_URL) {
      throw new Error('DATABASE_URL is not set in environment variables');
    }
  });

  afterEach(async () => {
    // Clean up: delete all todos after each test
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  it('should add a todo to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new todo
    const newTodo = {
      title: 'Test Todo',
      description: 'This is a test todo item',
      completed: false,
    };

    // Act: Insert the todo into the database
    const insertedTodos = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(newTodo)
      .returning();

    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    const insertedTodo = insertedTodos[0];

    // Assert: Verify the inserted todo has the correct data
    expect(insertedTodo.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedTodo.title).toBe(newTodo.title);
    expect(insertedTodo.description).toBe(newTodo.description);
    expect(insertedTodo.completed).toBe(false);
    expect(insertedTodo.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedTodo.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the todo back from the database
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify we can successfully query the todo back
    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    const queriedTodo = queriedTodos[0];

    expect(queriedTodo.id).toBe(insertedTodo.id);
    expect(queriedTodo.title).toBe(newTodo.title);
    expect(queriedTodo.description).toBe(newTodo.description);
    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(false);
  });

  it('should insert multiple todos and query them all', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple todos
    const todosToInsert = [
      { title: 'First Todo', description: 'First description', completed: false },
      { title: 'Second Todo', description: 'Second description', completed: true },
      { title: 'Third Todo', description: null, completed: false },
    ];

    // Act: Insert multiple todos
    const insertedTodos = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(todosToInsert)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify all todos were inserted
    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(3);

    // Act: Query all todos
    const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

    // Assert: Verify we can query all todos back
    expect(allTodos).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(allTodos[0].title).toBe('First Todo');
    expect(allTodos[1].title).toBe('Second Todo');
    expect(allTodos[2].title).toBe('Third Todo');
  });

  it('should update a todo and verify the changes', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({
        title: 'Todo to Update',
        description: 'Original description',
        completed: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the todo
    const [updatedTodo] = await db
      .update(todos)
      .set({ completed: true, description: 'Updated description' })
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the update
    expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(updatedTodo.description).toBe('Updated description');

    // Query back to confirm persistence
    const [queriedTodo] = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(queriedTodo.description).toBe('Updated description');
  });

  it('should delete a todo from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({
        title: 'Todo to Delete',
        description: 'This will be deleted',
        completed: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Delete the todo
    await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the todo is deleted
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  it('should filter todos by completion status', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert todos with different statuses
    await db.insert(todos).values([
      { title: 'Completed Todo 1', completed: true },
      { title: 'Incomplete Todo 1', completed: false },
      { title: 'Completed Todo 2', completed: true },
      { title: 'Incomplete Todo 2', completed: false },
    ]);

    // Act: Query only completed todos
    const completedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.completed, true));

    // Assert: Verify only completed todos are returned
    expect(completedTodos).toHaveLength(2);
    expect(completedTodos.every(todo => todo.completed)).toBe(true);

    // Act: Query only incomplete todos
    const incompleteTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.completed, false));

    // Assert: Verify only incomplete todos are returned
    expect(incompleteTodos).toHaveLength(2);
    expect(incompleteTodos.every(todo => !todo.completed)).toBe(true);
  });
});

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('Todo Integration Tests', () => {
  // Clean up before each test to ensure isolation
  beforeEach(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  afterAll(async () => {
    // Clean up all todos after tests complete
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  it('should add a todo to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new todo
    const newTodo = {
      title: 'Test Todo',
      description: 'This is a test todo item',
      completed: false,
    };

    // Act: Insert the todo into the database
    const insertedTodos = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(newTodo)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the todo was inserted
    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(insertedTodos[0]).toMatchObject({
      title: newTodo.title,
      description: newTodo.description,
      completed: newTodo.completed,
    });
    expect(insertedTodos[0].id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedTodos[0].createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedTodos[0].updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the todo back from the database
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodos[0].id));

    // Assert: Verify the queried todo matches what we inserted
    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(queriedTodos[0]).toEqual(insertedTodos[0]);
  });

  it('should add multiple todos and query them all', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple todos
    const newTodos = [
      { title: 'First Todo', description: 'First test', completed: false },
      { title: 'Second Todo', description: 'Second test', completed: true },
      { title: 'Third Todo', description: null, completed: false },
    ];

    // Act: Insert multiple todos
    const insertedTodos = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(newTodos)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify all todos were inserted
    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(3);

    // Act: Query all todos
    const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

    // Assert: Verify we can query all todos back
    expect(allTodos).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(allTodos[0].title).toBe('First Todo');
    expect(allTodos[1].title).toBe('Second Todo');
    expect(allTodos[2].title).toBe('Third Todo');
  });

  it('should update a todo and verify the changes', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({
        title: 'Todo to Update',
        description: 'Original description',
        completed: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the todo
    const [updatedTodo] = await db
      .update(todos)
      .set({ completed: true, description: 'Updated description' })
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the update
    expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(updatedTodo.description).toBe('Updated description');
    expect(updatedTodo.title).toBe('Todo to Update');

    // Query to double-check
    const [queriedTodo] = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(queriedTodo.description).toBe('Updated description');
  });

  it('should delete a todo from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({
        title: 'Todo to Delete',
        description: 'Will be deleted',
        completed: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Verify it exists
    const todosBeforeDelete = await db.select().from(todos);
    expect(todosBeforeDelete).toHaveLength(1);

    // Act: Delete the todo
    await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify it was deleted
    const todosAfterDelete = await db.select().from(todos);
    expect(todosAfterDelete).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  it('should filter todos by completion status', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert todos with different completion statuses
    await db.insert(todos).values([
      { title: 'Completed Todo 1', completed: true },
      { title: 'Incomplete Todo 1', completed: false },
      { title: 'Completed Todo 2', completed: true },
      { title: 'Incomplete Todo 2', completed: false },
    ]);

    // Act: Query only completed todos
    const completedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.completed, true));

    // Assert: Verify we only get completed todos
    expect(completedTodos).toHaveLength(2);
    expect(completedTodos.every(todo => todo.completed)).toBe(true);

    // Act: Query only incomplete todos
    const incompleteTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.completed, false));

    // Assert: Verify we only get incomplete todos
    expect(incompleteTodos).toHaveLength(2);
    expect(incompleteTodos.every(todo => !todo.completed)).toBe(true);
  });
});

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('Todo Integration Tests', () => {
  // Clean up before and after tests
  beforeAll(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  afterAll(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  it('should add a todo to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Insert a new todo
    const newTodo = {
      title: 'Test Todo',
      description: 'This is a test todo item',
      completed: false,
    };

    const insertedTodos = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(newTodo)
      .returning();

    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(insertedTodos[0]).toMatchObject({
      title: 'Test Todo',
      description: 'This is a test todo item',
      completed: false,
    });
    expect(insertedTodos[0].id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedTodos[0].createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedTodos[0].updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Query the todo back from the database
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodos[0].id));

    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(queriedTodos[0]).toMatchObject({
      id: insertedTodos[0].id,
      title: 'Test Todo',
      description: 'This is a test todo item',
      completed: false,
    });
  });

  it('should add multiple todos and query them all', async () => {
    // Clean previous test data
    await db.delete(todos);

    // Insert multiple todos
    const newTodos = [
      { title: 'Todo 1', description: 'First todo', completed: false },
      { title: 'Todo 2', description: 'Second todo', completed: true },
      { title: 'Todo 3', description: 'Third todo', completed: false },
    ];

    const insertedTodos = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(newTodos)
      .returning();

    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(3);

    // Query all todos
    const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

    expect(allTodos).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(allTodos[0].title).toBe('Todo 1');
    expect(allTodos[1].title).toBe('Todo 2');
    expect(allTodos[2].title).toBe('Todo 3');
  });

  it('should update a todo', async () => {
    // Clean previous test data
    await db.delete(todos);

    // Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({ title: 'Original Title', completed: false })
      .returning();

    // Update the todo
    const [updatedTodo] = await db
      .update(todos)
      .set({ title: 'Updated Title', completed: true })
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
      .returning();

    expect(updatedTodo.title).toBe('Updated Title');
    expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);

    // Query and verify
    const [queriedTodo] = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    expect(queriedTodo.title).toBe('Updated Title');
    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
  });

  it('should delete a todo', async () => {
    // Clean previous test data
    await db.delete(todos);

    // Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({ title: 'To Be Deleted', completed: false })
      .returning();

    // Delete the todo
    await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Try to query it back
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  it('should filter completed todos', async () => {
    // Clean previous test data
    await db.delete(todos);

    // Insert todos with different completion status
    await db.insert(todos).values([
      { title: 'Completed 1', completed: true },
      { title: 'Not Completed', completed: false },
      { title: 'Completed 2', completed: true },
    ]);

    // Query only completed todos
    const completedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.completed, true));

    expect(completedTodos).toHaveLength(2);
    expect(completedTodos.every((todo) => todo.completed)).toBe(true);

A simple todo application built with Next.js, Neon PostgreSQL, and Drizzle ORM.

## Features

- ✅ Full CRUD operations for todos
- ✅ Drizzle ORM for type-safe database queries
- ✅ Neon serverless PostgreSQL database
- ✅ Comprehensive integration tests using Vitest

## Database Schema

The `todos` table includes:
- `id` - Serial primary key
- `title` - Text (required)
- `description` - Text (optional)
- `completed` - Boolean (default: false)
- `createdAt` - Timestamp (auto-generated)
- `updatedAt` - Timestamp (auto-generated)

## Project Structure

```
.
├── db/
│   ├── schema.ts       # Drizzle schema definitions
│   └── index.ts        # Database connection setup
├── __tests__/
│   └── todos.test.ts   # Integration tests
├── drizzle/            # Generated migrations
├── drizzle.config.ts   # Drizzle Kit configuration
└── .env.local          # Database connection string
```

## Setup

1. Install dependencies:
```bash
npm install
```

2. The database is already configured with:
   - Project: `todo-app-drizzle`
   - Database: `neondb`
   - Connection string in `.env.local`

3. Generate and push migrations:
```bash
npx drizzle-kit generate
npx drizzle-kit push
```

## Running Tests

Run the integration tests:
```bash
npm test
```

The test suite includes:
- ✅ Adding a todo and querying it back
- ✅ Adding multiple todos
- ✅ Updating todos
- ✅ Deleting todos
- ✅ Filtering completed todos

## Database Operations

### Insert a Todo
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';

const [newTodo] = await db
  .insert(todos)
  .values({ title: 'My Todo', completed: false })
  .returning();
```

### Query Todos
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

// Get all todos
const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

// Get by ID
const todo = await db
  .select()
  .from(todos)
  .where(eq(todos.id, 1));

// Get completed todos
const completed = await db
  .select()
  .from(todos)
  .where(eq(todos.completed, true));
```

### Update a Todo
```typescript
await db
  .update(todos)
  .set({ completed: true })
  .where(eq(todos.id, 1));
```

### Delete a Todo
```typescript
await db
  .delete(todos)
  .where(eq(todos.id, 1));
```

## Technology Stack

- **Next.js 16** - React framework
- **Neon** - Serverless PostgreSQL
- **Drizzle ORM** - Type-safe ORM
- **TypeScript** - Type safety
- **Vitest** - Testing framework

## Database Connection

The application uses Neon's HTTP connection adapter (`@neondatabase/serverless`) with `drizzle-orm/neon-http`, which is optimized for:
- Serverless environments (Vercel, Netlify, etc.)
- Edge functions
- Low latency HTTP connections

## Environment Variables

Required environment variables in `.env.local`:
- `DATABASE_URL` - Neon PostgreSQL connection string

## License

MIT

   - Created a new Neon project: `todo-app-drizzle`
   - Database: `neondb`
   - Connection configured in `.env.local`

2. **Drizzle ORM Integration**
   - **`db/schema.ts`** - Todo table schema with:

     - `title` (required)
     - `description` (optional)

   - **`db/index.ts`** - Database connection using Neon HTTP adapter
   - **`drizzle.config.ts`** - Drizzle Kit configuration
   - Generated and applied migrations to the database

3. **Integration Tests (`__tests__/todos.test.ts`)**
   The test suite includes 5 comprehensive tests:
   
   ✅ **Add and query a todo** - Inserts a todo and retrieves it successfully
   ```typescript
   - Inserts with title, description, completed status
   - Verifies all fields including auto-generated timestamps
   - Queries back by ID and confirms data integrity
   ```

   ✅ **Add multiple todos** - Batch insert and query operations
   
   ✅ **Update a todo** - Modifies title and completion status
   
   ✅ **Delete a todo** - Removes a todo and verifies deletion
   
   ✅ **Filter completed todos** - Query with WHERE conditions

```

```
.
├── db/
│   ├── schema.ts       # Drizzle schema with todos table
│   └── index.ts        # Database connection
├── __tests__/
│   └── todos.test.ts   # Integration tests (5 tests)

├── drizzle.config.ts   # Drizzle configuration
├── vitest.config.ts    # Updated with path aliases

```

### 🔑 Key Features of the Tests

- **Uses Drizzle Syntax**: All database operations use Drizzle's type-safe query builder
- **Full CRUD Coverage**: Create, Read, Update, Delete operations
- **Query Patterns**: Demonstrates filtering with `eq()` and complex queries

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed

import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos, type NewTodo } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('Todos Integration Test', () => {
  // Clean up before each test
  beforeEach(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  it('should add a todo to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new todo object
    const newTodo: NewTodo = {
      title: 'Buy groceries',
      description: 'Milk, eggs, bread, and coffee',
      completed: false,
    };

    // Act: Insert the todo into the database
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(newTodo)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the inserted todo has an ID and matches input
    expect(insertedTodo).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedTodo.id).toBeTypeOf('number');
    expect(insertedTodo.title).toBe(newTodo.title);
    expect(insertedTodo.description).toBe(newTodo.description);
    expect(insertedTodo.completed).toBe(false);
    expect(insertedTodo.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedTodo.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the todo back from the database
    const queriedTodo = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify we can query it back and it matches
    expect(queriedTodo).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(queriedTodo[0]).toEqual(insertedTodo);
    expect(queriedTodo[0].title).toBe('Buy groceries');
    expect(queriedTodo[0].description).toBe('Milk, eggs, bread, and coffee');
  });

  it('should insert multiple todos and query them all', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple todos
    const newTodos: NewTodo[] = [
      {
        title: 'Complete project',
        description: 'Finish the todo app',
        completed: false,
      },
      {
        title: 'Write tests',
        description: 'Add integration tests',
        completed: true,
      },
      {
        title: 'Deploy app',
        description: 'Deploy to production',
        completed: false,
      },
    ];

    // Act: Insert multiple todos
    const insertedTodos = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(newTodos)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify all todos were inserted
    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(insertedTodos[0].title).toBe('Complete project');
    expect(insertedTodos[1].title).toBe('Write tests');
    expect(insertedTodos[1].completed).toBe(true);
    expect(insertedTodos[2].title).toBe('Deploy app');

    // Act: Query all todos
    const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

    // Assert: Verify we can query them all back
    expect(allTodos).toHaveLength(3);
  });

  it('should update a todo and verify the changes', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({
        title: 'Incomplete task',
        completed: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the todo to mark it as completed
    const [updatedTodo] = await db
      .update(todos)
      .set({ completed: true })
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the update
    expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(updatedTodo.id).toBe(insertedTodo.id);

    // Act: Query it back to verify persistence
    const [queriedTodo] = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the change persisted
    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
  });

  it('should delete a todo from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({
        title: 'Task to delete',
        completed: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Delete the todo
    await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify it no longer exists
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(0);
  });
});

A simple todo application built with Neon Postgres and Drizzle ORM, featuring comprehensive integration tests.

## Features

- ✅ Neon Postgres serverless database
- ✅ Drizzle ORM for type-safe database queries
- ✅ Complete CRUD operations for todos
- ✅ Integration tests using Vitest

## Database Schema

The `todos` table includes:
- `id` - Auto-incrementing primary key
- `title` - Todo title (required)
- `description` - Optional description
- `completed` - Boolean status (default: false)
- `createdAt` - Timestamp of creation
- `updatedAt` - Timestamp of last update

## Setup

1. **Install dependencies:**
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

2. **Environment variables:**
   The `.env` file contains your Neon database connection string:
   ```
   DATABASE_URL=postgresql://...
   ```

3. **Run migrations:**
   ```bash
   npx drizzle-kit generate  # Generate migration files
   npx drizzle-kit migrate   # Apply migrations
   ```

## Running Tests

Run the integration tests:
```bash
npm test
```

The test suite includes:
- ✅ Adding a todo and querying it back
- ✅ Inserting multiple todos
- ✅ Updating todo status
- ✅ Deleting todos

## Project Structure

```
.
├── db/
│   ├── schema.ts         # Drizzle schema definition
│   └── index.ts          # Database client configuration
├── __tests__/
│   └── todos.integration.test.ts  # Integration tests
├── drizzle/              # Generated migrations
├── drizzle.config.ts     # Drizzle Kit configuration
└── .env                  # Database credentials
```

## Using Drizzle ORM

### Insert a todo:
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';

const [newTodo] = await db
  .insert(todos)
  .values({
    title: 'Buy groceries',
    description: 'Milk, eggs, bread',
    completed: false,
  })
  .returning();
```

### Query todos:
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';

const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);
```

### Update a todo:
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

await db
  .update(todos)
  .set({ completed: true })
  .where(eq(todos.id, todoId));
```

### Delete a todo:
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, todoId));
```

## Technologies

- [Neon](https://neon.tech) - Serverless Postgres
- [Drizzle ORM](https://orm.drizzle.team) - TypeScript ORM
- [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) - React Framework
- [Vitest](https://vitest.dev) - Testing Framework

├── drizzle.config.ts     # Drizzle Kit configuration
└── .env                  # Database credentials
```

## Using Drizzle ORM

### Insert a todo:
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';

const [newTodo] = await db
  .insert(todos)
  .values({
    title: 'Buy groceries',
    description: 'Milk, eggs, bread',
    completed: false,
  })
  .returning();
```

### Query todos:
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';

const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);
```

### Update a todo:
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

await db
  .update(todos)
  .set({ completed: true })
  .where(eq(todos.id, todoId));
```

### Delete a todo:
```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, todoId));
```

## Development

Run the development server:
```bash
npm run dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

## Technologies

- [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) - React Framework
- [Neon](https://neon.tech) - Serverless Postgres
- [Drizzle ORM](https://orm.drizzle.team) - TypeScript ORM
- [Vitest](https://vitest.dev) - Testing Framework"}}],"stop_reason":null,"stop_sequence":null,"usage":{"input_tokens":1,"cache_creation_input_tokens":701,"cache_read_input_tokens":38969,"cache_creation":{"ephemeral_5m_input_tokens":701,"ephemeral_1h_input_tokens":0},"output_tokens":25,"service_tier":"standard"}},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"6cbd6eb0-1521-46c7-80c2-3daedcda0050","uuid":"612ff28e-4cfc-4789-b88f-07b5404c0ce3"},{"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01Hozbua4eVzvQ9FCgXFwKuV","type":"tool_result","content":"The file README.md has been updated. # Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)
