    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  afterAll(async () => {
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  it('should add a todo to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new todo
    const newTodo: NewTodo = {
      title: 'Test Todo',
      description: 'This is a test todo item',
      completed: false,
    };

    // Act: Insert the todo into the database
    const insertedTodos = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodo).returning();
    const insertedTodo = insertedTodos[0];

    // Assert: Verify the todo was inserted correctly
    expect(insertedTodo).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedTodo.id).toBeTypeOf('number');
    expect(insertedTodo.title).toBe(newTodo.title);
    expect(insertedTodo.description).toBe(newTodo.description);
    expect(insertedTodo.completed).toBe(false);
    expect(insertedTodo.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedTodo.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the todo back from the database
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));
    const queriedTodo = queriedTodos[0];

    // Assert: Verify the queried todo matches the inserted todo
    expect(queriedTodo).toBeDefined();
    expect(queriedTodo.id).toBe(insertedTodo.id);
    expect(queriedTodo.title).toBe(insertedTodo.title);
    expect(queriedTodo.description).toBe(insertedTodo.description);
    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(insertedTodo.completed);
    expect(queriedTodo.createdAt.getTime()).toBe(insertedTodo.createdAt.getTime());
    expect(queriedTodo.updatedAt.getTime()).toBe(insertedTodo.updatedAt.getTime());
  });

  it('should insert multiple todos and query them all', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple todos
    const newTodos: NewTodo[] = [
      {
        title: 'First Todo',
        description: 'First test todo',
        completed: false,
      },
      {
        title: 'Second Todo',
        description: 'Second test todo',
        completed: true,
      },
      {
        title: 'Third Todo',
        completed: false,
      },
    ];

    // Act: Insert multiple todos
    const insertedTodos = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodos).returning();

    // Assert: Verify all todos were inserted
    expect(insertedTodos).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(insertedTodos[0].title).toBe('First Todo');
    expect(insertedTodos[1].title).toBe('Second Todo');
    expect(insertedTodos[1].completed).toBe(true);
    expect(insertedTodos[2].title).toBe('Third Todo');
    expect(insertedTodos[2].description).toBeNull();

    // Act: Query all todos
    const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

    // Assert: Verify we can retrieve all todos
    expect(allTodos.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(3);
  });

  it('should update a todo and verify the changes', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const newTodo: NewTodo = {
      title: 'Todo to Update',
      description: 'Original description',
      completed: false,
    };
    const [insertedTodo] = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodo).returning();

    // Act: Update the todo
    const [updatedTodo] = await db
      .update(todos)
      .set({
        title: 'Updated Todo',
        description: 'Updated description',
        completed: true,
      })
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the update
    expect(updatedTodo.id).toBe(insertedTodo.id);
    expect(updatedTodo.title).toBe('Updated Todo');
    expect(updatedTodo.description).toBe('Updated description');
    expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);

    // Act: Query the updated todo
    const [queriedTodo] = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the queried todo has the updated values
    expect(queriedTodo.title).toBe('Updated Todo');
    expect(queriedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
  });

  it('should delete a todo from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const newTodo: NewTodo = {
      title: 'Todo to Delete',
      completed: false,
    };
    const [insertedTodo] = await db.insert(todos).values(newTodo).returning();

    // Act: Delete the todo
    await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Act: Try to query the deleted todo
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Verify the todo was deleted
    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  it('should filter todos by completion status', async () => {
    // Arrange: Clear database and insert todos with different statuses
    await db.delete(todos);
    const testTodos: NewTodo[] = [
      { title: 'Completed 1', completed: true },
      { title: 'Incomplete 1', completed: false },
      { title: 'Completed 2', completed: true },
      { title: 'Incomplete 2', completed: false },
    ];
    await db.insert(todos).values(testTodos);

    // Act: Query completed todos
    const completedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.completed, true));

    // Act: Query incomplete todos
    const incompleteTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.completed, false));

    // Assert: Verify filtering works correctly
    expect(completedTodos).toHaveLength(2);
    expect(incompleteTodos).toHaveLength(2);
    expect(completedTodos.every(todo => todo.completed)).toBe(true);
    expect(incompleteTodos.every(todo => !todo.completed)).toBe(true);
  });
});

## 🎉 Summary

### Database Setup
- **Provisioned Neon Database**: Created a new Neon project named "todo-app-drizzle"
- **Project ID**: `summer-water-42273321`

### Drizzle ORM Setup
1. **Installed Dependencies**:
   - `drizzle-orm` - ORM library
   - `@neondatabase/serverless` - Neon's serverless PostgreSQL driver
   - `drizzle-kit` - Migration and schema management tool

2. **Created Todo Schema** (`db/schema.ts`):
   - `id` - Auto-incrementing primary key
   - `title` - Todo title (required)
   - `description` - Optional description
   - `completed` - Boolean status (defaults to false)
   - `createdAt` - Timestamp of creation
   - `updatedAt` - Timestamp of last update

3. **Database Connection** (`db/index.ts`):
   - Configured Neon serverless connection pool
   - Set up Drizzle client with schema

4. **Configuration** (`drizzle.config.ts`):

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

import { db } from '@/db';
import { todos } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
import * as dotenv from 'dotenv';

// Load environment variables
dotenv.config({ path: '.env.local' });

describe('Todo Integration Tests', () => {
  // Clean up test data after all tests
  afterAll(async () => {
    // Delete all test todos
    await db.delete(todos);
  });

  it('should add a todo to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new todo
    const newTodo = {
      title: 'Test Todo',
      description: 'This is a test todo item',
      completed: false,
    };

    // Act: Insert the todo into the database
    const insertResult = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(newTodo)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Check that the todo was inserted
    expect(insertResult).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(insertResult[0]).toMatchObject({
      title: newTodo.title,
      description: newTodo.description,
      completed: newTodo.completed,
    });
    expect(insertResult[0].id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertResult[0].createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertResult[0].updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    const insertedTodoId = insertResult[0].id;

    // Act: Query the todo back from the database
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodoId));

    // Assert: Check that the todo was queried successfully
    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(queriedTodos[0]).toMatchObject({
      id: insertedTodoId,
      title: newTodo.title,
      description: newTodo.description,
      completed: newTodo.completed,
    });
  });

  it('should add multiple todos and query them all', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple todos
    const newTodos = [
      { title: 'First Todo', description: 'First test item', completed: false },
      { title: 'Second Todo', description: 'Second test item', completed: true },
      { title: 'Third Todo', description: null, completed: false },
    ];

    // Act: Insert multiple todos
    const insertResults = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values(newTodos)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Check that all todos were inserted
    expect(insertResults).toHaveLength(3);

    // Act: Query all todos
    const allTodos = await db.select().from(todos);

    // Assert: Check that we have at least the 3 we just inserted (plus the one from the previous test)
    expect(allTodos.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(3);
  });

  it('should update a todo', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({ title: 'Todo to Update', completed: false })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the todo
    const [updatedTodo] = await db
      .update(todos)
      .set({ completed: true, title: 'Updated Todo' })
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Check that the todo was updated
    expect(updatedTodo.completed).toBe(true);
    expect(updatedTodo.title).toBe('Updated Todo');
    expect(updatedTodo.id).toBe(insertedTodo.id);
  });

  it('should delete a todo', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a todo
    const [insertedTodo] = await db
      .insert(todos)
      .values({ title: 'Todo to Delete', completed: false })
      .returning();

    // Act: Delete the todo
    await db.delete(todos).where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Act: Try to query the deleted todo
    const queriedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.id, insertedTodo.id));

    // Assert: Check that the todo was deleted
    expect(queriedTodos).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  it('should filter completed todos', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert some todos with different completion states
    await db.insert(todos).values([
      { title: 'Completed 1', completed: true },
      { title: 'Not Completed 1', completed: false },
      { title: 'Completed 2', completed: true },
    ]);

    // Act: Query only completed todos
    const completedTodos = await db
      .select()
      .from(todos)
      .where(eq(todos.completed, true));

    // Assert: Check that we only get completed todos
    expect(completedTodos.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(2);
    completedTodos.forEach(todo => {
      expect(todo.completed).toBe(true);
    });
  });
});

## Summary

### Database Setup
- ✅ **Neon Database Provisioned**: Project "todo-app" (ID: rapid-shape-13231655)
- ✅ **Dependencies Installed**: 
  - `@neondatabase/serverless` - Neon serverless driver
  - `drizzle-orm` - Drizzle ORM
  - `drizzle-kit` - Migration tool

### Database Schema (`db/schema.ts`)
Created a `todos` table with:
- `id` - Auto-incrementing primary key
- `title` - Required text field
- `description` - Optional text field
- `completed` - Boolean flag (default: false)
- `createdAt` - Timestamp with auto-now on creation
- `updatedAt` - Timestamp with auto-now on update

### Configuration Files
- **`.env.local`** - Database connection string
- **`drizzle.config.ts`** - Drizzle Kit configuration
- **`db/index.ts`** - Database connection utility with Drizzle instance
- **`vitest.config.ts`** - Updated with path alias support

### Integration Tests (`__tests__/todos.test.ts`)
Created 5 comprehensive tests that verify:

1. ✅ **Add and Query** - Insert a todo and retrieve it successfully
2. ✅ **Multiple Todos** - Insert multiple todos and query them all
3. ✅ **Update Todo** - Modify a todo's properties
4. ✅ **Delete Todo** - Remove a todo from the database
5. ✅ **Filter Todos** - Query todos by completion status

**All 5 tests passed successfully!** ✨

The tests use authentic Drizzle syntax with:
- `.insert()`, `.select()`, `.update()`, `.delete()` operations
- `.where(eq())` for filtering
- `.returning()` for getting inserted/updated data
- Type-safe queries with full TypeScript support

You can run the tests anytime with `npm test`. # Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

import { drizzle } from 'drizzle-orm/neon-serverless';
import { Pool } from '@neondatabase/serverless';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
import * as schema from '@/db/schema';
import * as dotenv from 'dotenv';

// Load environment variables
dotenv.config({ path: '.env.local' });

describe('Notes Integration Test', () => {
  let pool: Pool;
  let db: ReturnType<typeof drizzle>;

  beforeAll(() => {
    if (!process.env.DATABASE_URL) {
      throw new Error('DATABASE_URL is not set');
    }

    pool = new Pool({ connectionString: process.env.DATABASE_URL });
    db = drizzle(pool, { schema });
  });

  afterAll(async () => {
    // Clean up test data
    await db.delete(schema.notes);
    await pool.end();
  });

  it('should add a note to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new note
    const newNote = {
      title: 'Test Note',
      content: 'This is a test note content',
    };

    // Act: Insert the note into the database
    const insertedNotes = await db
      .insert(schema.notes)
      .values(newNote)
      .returning();

    expect(insertedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    const insertedNote = insertedNotes[0];

    // Assert: Verify the inserted note has expected properties
    expect(insertedNote.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedNote.title).toBe(newNote.title);
    expect(insertedNote.content).toBe(newNote.content);
    expect(insertedNote.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedNote.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the note back from the database
    const queriedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(schema.notes)
      .where(eq(schema.notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    // Assert: Verify the queried note matches the inserted note
    expect(queriedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    const queriedNote = queriedNotes[0];

    expect(queriedNote.id).toBe(insertedNote.id);
    expect(queriedNote.title).toBe(newNote.title);
    expect(queriedNote.content).toBe(newNote.content);
    expect(queriedNote.createdAt.getTime()).toBe(insertedNote.createdAt.getTime());
    expect(queriedNote.updatedAt.getTime()).toBe(insertedNote.updatedAt.getTime());
  });

  it('should query all notes from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert multiple notes
    const notes = [
      { title: 'First Note', content: 'First content' },
      { title: 'Second Note', content: 'Second content' },
      { title: 'Third Note', content: 'Third content' },
    ];

    await db.insert(schema.notes).values(notes);

    // Act: Query all notes
    const allNotes = await db.select().from(schema.notes);

    // Assert: Verify all notes are returned (at least our 3 test notes)
    expect(allNotes.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(3);

    const titles = allNotes.map(note => note.title);
    expect(titles).toContain('First Note');
    expect(titles).toContain('Second Note');
    expect(titles).toContain('Third Note');
  });

  it('should update a note in the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a note
    const [note] = await db
      .insert(schema.notes)
      .values({ title: 'Original Title', content: 'Original Content' })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the note
    const updatedTitle = 'Updated Title';
    const updatedContent = 'Updated Content';

    await db
      .update(schema.notes)
      .set({ title: updatedTitle, content: updatedContent })
      .where(eq(schema.notes.id, note.id));

    // Assert: Query and verify the update
    const [updatedNote] = await db
      .select()
      .from(schema.notes)
      .where(eq(schema.notes.id, note.id));

    expect(updatedNote.title).toBe(updatedTitle);
    expect(updatedNote.content).toBe(updatedContent);
  });

  it('should delete a note from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a note
    const [note] = await db
      .insert(schema.notes)
      .values({ title: 'To Be Deleted', content: 'This will be deleted' })
      .returning();

    // Act: Delete the note
    await db.delete(schema.notes).where(eq(schema.notes.id, note.id));

    // Assert: Verify the note is deleted
    const deletedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(schema.notes)
      .where(eq(schema.notes.id, note.id));

    expect(deletedNotes).toHaveLength(0);
  });
});

import { db } from '@/db';
import { notes } from '@/db/schema';

export async function GET() {
  try {
    const allNotes = await db.select().from(notes);
    return NextResponse.json(allNotes);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error fetching notes:', error);
    return NextResponse.json(
      { error: 'Failed to fetch notes' },
      { status: 500 }
    );
  }
}

export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
  try {
    const body = await request.json();
    const { title, content } = body;

    if (!title || !content) {
      return NextResponse.json(
        { error: 'Title and content are required' },
        { status: 400 }
      );
    }

    const [newNote] = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values({ title, content })
      .returning();

    return NextResponse.json(newNote, { status: 201 });
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error creating note:', error);
    return NextResponse.json(
      { error: 'Failed to create note' },
      { status: 500 }
    );
  }
}

This is a notes application built with Next.js 16, Drizzle ORM, and Neon Serverless Postgres.

## Features

- ✅ Full-stack Next.js 16 application
- ✅ Neon Serverless Postgres database
- ✅ Drizzle ORM for type-safe database queries
- ✅ RESTful API routes for CRUD operations
- ✅ Comprehensive integration tests using Vitest

## Project Structure

```
.
├── app/
│   └── api/
│       └── notes/
│           └── route.ts          # API endpoints for notes
├── db/
│   ├── index.ts                  # Database client setup
│   ├── schema.ts                 # Drizzle schema definition
│   └── migrations/               # Database migrations
├── __tests__/
│   └── notes.integration.test.ts # Integration tests
├── drizzle.config.ts             # Drizzle Kit configuration
└── .env.local                    # Environment variables (DATABASE_URL)
```

## Database Schema

The notes table includes:
- `id` - Serial primary key
- `title` - Text, not null
- `content` - Text, not null
- `created_at` - Timestamp with default now()
- `updated_at` - Timestamp with default now()

## API Endpoints

### GET /api/notes
Fetch all notes from the database.

**Response:**
```json
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "title": "My First Note",
    "content": "This is the content",
    "createdAt": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
    "updatedAt": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
  }
]
```

### POST /api/notes
Create a new note.

**Request Body:**
```json
{
  "title": "Note Title",
  "content": "Note content"
}
```

**Response:**
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "title": "Note Title",
  "content": "Note content",
  "createdAt": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "updatedAt": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"
}
```

## Running the Tests

The integration tests verify:
- ✅ Adding a note and querying it back
- ✅ Querying all notes
- ✅ Updating a note
- ✅ Deleting a note

Run the tests with:
```bash
npm test
```

## Development

1. **Install dependencies:**
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

2. **Run migrations:**
   ```bash
   npx drizzle-kit generate
   npx drizzle-kit push
   ```

3. **Start the development server:**
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

4. **Run tests:**
   ```bash
   npm test
   ```

## Database Management

### Generate new migrations
```bash
npx drizzle-kit generate
```

### Push schema changes to database
```bash
npx drizzle-kit push
```

### Open Drizzle Studio (database GUI)
```bash
npx drizzle-kit studio
```

## Technologies

- **Next.js 16** - React framework with App Router
- **Neon** - Serverless Postgres
- **Drizzle ORM** - TypeScript ORM
- **Vitest** - Testing framework
- **TypeScript** - Type safety

## Environment Variables

Create a `.env.local` file with:
```
DATABASE_URL="postgresql://user:password@host/database"
```

    11→describe('Notes Integration Test', () => {

    37→    // Act: Insert the note into the database

    40→      .values(newNote)
    41→      .returning();
    42→
    43→    expect(insertedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    44→    const insertedNote = insertedNotes[0];
    45→
    46→    // Assert: Verify the inserted note has expected properties
    47→    expect(insertedNote.id).toBeDefined();
    48→    expect(insertedNote.title).toBe(newNote.title);
    49→    expect(insertedNote.content).toBe(newNote.content);
    50→    expect(insertedNote.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    51→    expect(insertedNote.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    52→
    53→    // Act: Query the note back from the database
    54→    const queriedNotes = await db
    55→      .select()
    56→      .from(schema.notes)
    57→      .where(eq(schema.notes.id, insertedNote.id));
    58→
    59→    // Assert: Verify the queried note matches the inserted note
    60→    expect(queriedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    61→    const queriedNote = queriedNotes[0];
    62→
    63→    expect(queriedNote.id).toBe(insertedNote.id);
    64→    expect(queriedNote.title).toBe(newNote.title);
    65→    expect(queriedNote.content).toBe(newNote.content);
    66→    expect(queriedNote.createdAt.getTime()).toBe(insertedNote.createdAt.getTime());
    67→    expect(queriedNote.updatedAt.getTime()).toBe(insertedNote.updatedAt.getTime());
    68→  });
    69→
    70→  it('should query all notes from the database', async () => {

    74→      { title: 'Second Note', content: 'Second content' },
    75→      { title: 'Third Note', content: 'Third content' },

    77→
    78→    await db.insert(schema.notes).values(notes);

    90→  });

    98→
    99→    // Act: Update the note
   100→    const updatedTitle = 'Updated Title';

   102→

   107→
   108→    // Assert: Query and verify the update
   109→    const [updatedNote] = await db

   111→      .from(schema.notes)
   112→      .where(eq(schema.notes.id, note.id));
   113→
   114→    expect(updatedNote.title).toBe(updatedTitle);

   117→

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

Use this rules when integrating Neon (serverless Postgres) with Drizzle ORM\nglobs: *.ts, *.tsx\nalwaysApply: false\n---\n# Neon and Drizzle Integration Guidelines\n\n## Overview\n\nThis guide covers the specific integration patterns, configurations, and optimizations for using **Drizzle ORM** with **Neon** Postgres. Follow these guidelines to ensure efficient, secure, and robust database operations in serverless and traditional environments.\n\n## Dependencies\nFor Neon with Drizzle ORM integration, include these specific dependencies. The `ws` package is required for persistent WebSocket connections in Node.js environments older than v22.\n\n```bash\nnpm install drizzle-orm @neondatabase/serverless ws\nnpm install -D drizzle-kit dotenv @types/ws\n```\n\n## Neon Connection String\nAlways use the Neon connection string format and store it in an environment file (`.env`, `.env.local`).\n\n```text\nDATABASE_URL=\"postgresql://[user]:[password]@[neon_hostname]/[dbname]?sslmode=require&channel_binding=require\"\n```\n\n## Connection Setup: Choosing the Right Driver Adapter\n\nNeon's serverless driver offers two connection methods: HTTP and WebSocket. Drizzle has a specific adapter for each.\n\n### 1. HTTP Adapter (Recommended for Serverless/Edge)\nThis method is ideal for short-lived, stateless environments like Vercel Edge Functions or AWS Lambda. It uses `fetch` for each query, resulting in very low latency for single operations.\n\n- Use the `neon` client from `@neondatabase/serverless`.\n- Use the `drizzle` adapter from `drizzle-orm/neon-http`.\n\n```typescript\n// src/db.ts\nimport { drizzle } from \"drizzle-orm/neon-http\";\nimport { neon } from \"@neondatabase/serverless\";\nimport { config } from \"dotenv\";\n\nconfig({ path: \".env\" });\n\nif (!process.env.DATABASE_URL) {\n  throw new Error('DATABASE_URL is not defined');\n}\n\nconst sql = neon(process.env.DATABASE_URL);\nexport const db = drizzle(sql);\n```\n\n### 2. WebSocket Adapter (for `node-postgres` compatibility)\nThis method is suitable for long-running applications (e.g., a standard Node.js server) or when you need support for interactive transactions. It maintains a persistent WebSocket connection.\n\n- Use the `Pool` client from `@neondatabase/serverless`.\n- Use the `drizzle` adapter from `drizzle-orm/neon-serverless`.\n- Configure the WebSocket constructor for Node.js environments older than v22.\n\n```typescript\n// src/db.ts\nimport { drizzle } from 'drizzle-orm/neon-serverless';\nimport { Pool, neonConfig } from '@neondatabase/serverless';\nimport { config } from \"dotenv\";\nimport ws from 'ws';\n\nconfig({ path: \".env\" });\n\nif (!process.env.DATABASE_URL) {\n  throw new Error('DATABASE_URL is not defined');\n}\n\n// Required for Node.js < v22\nneonConfig.webSocketConstructor = ws;\n\nconst pool = new Pool({ connectionString: process.env.DATABASE_URL });\nexport const db = drizzle(pool);\n```\n\n## Drizzle Config for Neon\nConfigure `drizzle.config.ts` to manage your schema and migrations. Neon is fully Postgres-compatible, so the dialect is `postgresql`.\n\n```typescript\n// drizzle.config.ts\nimport { config } from 'dotenv';\nimport { defineConfig } from \"drizzle-kit\";\n\nconfig({ path: '.env.local' }); // Use .env.local for local dev\n\nexport default defineConfig({\n  schema: \"./src/schema.ts\",\n  out: \"./drizzle\", // Or your preferred migrations folder\n  dialect: \"postgresql\",\n  dbCredentials: {\n    url: process.env.DATABASE_URL!,\n  }\n});\n\n```\n\n## Migrations with Drizzle Kit\n`drizzle-kit` is used to generate and apply schema changes to your Neon database.\n\n### 1. Generate Migrations\nAfter changing your schema in `src/schema.ts`, generate a new migration file.\n\n```bash\nnpx drizzle-kit generate\n```\nThis command reads your `drizzle.config.ts`, compares your schema to the database state, and creates SQL files in your output directory (`./drizzle`).\n\n### 2. Apply Migrations\nYou can apply migrations via the command line or programmatically.\n\n**Command Line:**\n```bash\nnpx drizzle-kit migrate\n```\n\n## Schema Considerations for Neon\n\n### Standard Postgres Schema\nDefine your schema using Postgres-specific types from `drizzle-orm/pg-core`.\n\n```typescript\n// src/schema.ts\nimport { pgTable, serial, text, integer, timestamp } from 'drizzle-orm/pg-core';\n\nexport const usersTable = pgTable('users', {\n  id: serial('id').primaryKey(),\n  name: text('name').notNull(),\n  email: text('email').notNull().unique(),\n  role: text('role').default('user').notNull(),\n  createdAt: timestamp('created_at').defaultNow().notNull(),\n});\n\n// Export types for type safety\nexport type User = typeof usersTable.$inferSelect;\nexport type NewUser = typeof usersTable.$inferInsert;\n\n// Example posts table for relationship demonstrations\nexport const postsTable = pgTable('posts', {\n  id: serial('id').primaryKey(),\n  title: text('title').notNull(),\n  content: text('content').notNull(),\n  userId: integer('user_id').notNull().references(() => usersTable.id, { onDelete: 'cascade' }),\n  createdAt: timestamp('created_at').defaultNow().notNull(),\n});\n\nexport type Post = typeof postsTable.$inferSelect;\nexport type NewPost = typeof postsTable.$inferInsert;\n```\n\n### Integrating the Neon Auth `users_sync` Table\nNeon Auth automatically synchronizes user data to a `neon_auth.users_sync` table. Drizzle provides a dedicated helper to integrate this seamlessly.\n\n- **Use the `usersSync` helper:** Import `usersSync` from `drizzle-orm/neon` to represent the table without defining its columns manually.\n- **Create foreign key relationships:** Link your application tables to `usersSync.id` to enforce data integrity.\n\n```typescript\n// src/schema.ts\nimport { pgTable, text, bigint, boolean, timestamp } from 'drizzle-orm/pg-core';\n// Import the dedicated Neon Auth helper from Drizzle\nimport { usersSync } from 'drizzle-orm/neon';\nimport { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';\n\n// Example: A `todos` table where each todo belongs to a Neon Auth user\nexport const todos = pgTable('todos', {\n  id: bigint('id', { mode: 'bigint' }).primaryKey().generatedByDefaultAsIdentity(),\n  task: text('task').notNull(),\n  isComplete: boolean('is_complete').default(false).notNull(),\n  insertedAt: timestamp('inserted_at').defaultNow().notNull(),\n  \n  // Create a foreign key relationship to the users_sync table\n  ownerId: text('owner_id')\n    .notNull()\n    .references(() => usersSync.id, { onDelete: 'cascade' }),\n});\n\n// This allows for direct SQL joins with user data\nasync function getTodosWithUserEmails(db) {\n  return db\n    .select({\n      task: todos.task,\n      ownerEmail: usersSync.email\n    })\n    .from(todos)\n    .leftJoin(usersSync, eq(todos.ownerId, usersSync.id));\n}\n```\n\n## Neon-Specific Query Optimizations\n\n### Efficient Queries for Serverless\nOptimize for Neon's serverless environment:\n- Keep connections short-lived\n- Use prepared statements for repeated queries\n- Batch operations when possible\n\n```typescript\n// Example of optimized query for Neon\nimport { db } from '../db';\nimport { sql } from 'drizzle-orm';\nimport { usersTable } from '../schema';\n\nexport async function batchInsertUsers(users: NewUser[]) {\n  // More efficient than multiple individual inserts on Neon\n  return db.insert(usersTable).values(users).returning();\n}\n\n// For complex queries, use prepared statements\nexport const getUsersByRolePrepared = db.select()\n  .from(usersTable)\n  .where(sql`${usersTable.role} = $1`)\n  .prepare('get_users_by_role');\n\n// Usage: getUsersByRolePrepared.execute(['admin'])\n```\n\n### Transaction Handling with Neon\nNeon supports transactions through Drizzle:\n\n```typescript\nimport { db } from '../db';\nimport { usersTable, postsTable } from '../schema';\n\nexport async function createUserWithPosts(user: NewUser, posts: NewPost[]) {\n  return await db.transaction(async (tx) => {\n    const [newUser] = await tx.insert(usersTable).values(user).returning();\n    \n    if (posts.length > 0) {\n      await tx.insert(postsTable).values(\n        posts.map(post => ({\n          ...post,\n          userId: newUser.id\n        }))\n      );\n    }\n    \n    return newUser;\n  });\n}\n```\n\n\n\n## Working with Neon Branches\nA key feature of Neon is database branching. You can create isolated copies of your database for development, testing, or preview environments. Manage connections to these branches using environment variables.\n\nHere is a common pattern for setting up your database client to connect to different branches based on the environment:\n\n```typescript\n// Using different Neon branches with environment variables\nimport { drizzle } from \"drizzle-orm/neon-http\";\nimport { neon } from \"@neondatabase/serverless\";\n\n// For multi-branch setup\nconst getBranchUrl = () => {\n  const env = process.env.NODE_ENV;\n  if (env === 'development') {\n    return process.env.DEV_DATABASE_URL;\n  } else if (env === 'test') {\n    return process.env.TEST_DATABASE_URL;\n  }\n  return process.env.DATABASE_URL;\n};\n\nconst sql = neon(getBranchUrl()!);\nexport const db = drizzle({ client: sql });\n```\n\n## Neon-Specific Error Handling\nHandle Neon-specific connection issues:\n\n```typescript\nimport { db } from '../db';\nimport { usersTable } from '../schema';\n\nexport async function safeNeonOperation<T>(operation: () => Promise<T>): Promise<T> {\n  try {\n    return await operation();\n  } catch (error: any) {\n    // Handle Neon-specific error codes\n    if (error.message?.includes('connection pool timeout')) {\n      console.error('Neon connection pool timeout');\n      // Handle appropriately\n    }\n    \n    // Re-throw for other handling\n    throw error;\n  }\n}\n\n// Usage\nexport async function getUserSafely(id: number) {\n  return safeNeonOperation(() => \n    db.select().from(usersTable).where(eq(usersTable.id, id))\n  );\n}\n```\n\n## Best Practices for Neon with Drizzle\n\n1. **Connection Management**\n   - Keep connection times short for serverless functions\n   - Use connection pooling for high traffic applications\n\n2. **Neon Features**\n   - Utilize Neon branching for development and testing\n   - Consider Neon's auto-scaling for database design\n\n3. **Query Optimization**\n   - Batch operations when possible\n   - Use prepared statements for repeated queries\n   - Optimize complex joins to minimize data transfer\n\n4. **Schema Design**\n   - Leverage Postgres-specific features supported by Neon\n   - Use appropriate indexes for your query patterns\n   - Consider Neon's performance characteristics for large tables"}]}"}]},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"4fa08958-ef56-45ec-b1a5-1b7d1cff7fa9","uuid":"889995c3-a01e-4cb6-86c5-7957dc53a7c9"},{"type":"assistant","message":{"model":"claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929","id":"msg_0153hBQm8RNAZLwbg7PLV6Jh","type":"message","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Perfect! export type NewNote = typeof notesTable.$inferInsert;

import { db } from '@/src/db';
import { notesTable, type NewNote } from '@/src/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('Notes Integration Tests', () => {
  // Clean up after each test
  afterEach(async () => {
    await db.delete(notesTable);
  });

  it('should add a note to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new note object
    const newNote: NewNote = {
      title: 'Test Note',
      content: 'This is a test note content',
      isArchived: false,
    };

    // Act: Insert the note into the database
    const [insertedNote] = await db
      .insert(notesTable)
      .values(newNote)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the note was inserted with an ID
    expect(insertedNote).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedNote.id).toBeGreaterThan(0);
    expect(insertedNote.title).toBe(newNote.title);
    expect(insertedNote.content).toBe(newNote.content);
    expect(insertedNote.isArchived).toBe(false);
    expect(insertedNote.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedNote.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the note back from the database
    const queriedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notesTable)
      .where(eq(notesTable.id, insertedNote.id));

    // Assert: Verify we got the note back
    expect(queriedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(queriedNotes[0]).toEqual(insertedNote);
  });

  it('should insert multiple notes and query them all', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple notes
    const notes: NewNote[] = [
      {
        title: 'First Note',
        content: 'First note content',
        isArchived: false,
      },
      {
        title: 'Second Note',
        content: 'Second note content',
        isArchived: true,
      },
      {
        title: 'Third Note',
        content: 'Third note content',
        isArchived: false,
      },
    ];

    // Act: Insert all notes
    const insertedNotes = await db
      .insert(notesTable)
      .values(notes)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify all notes were inserted
    expect(insertedNotes).toHaveLength(3);
    insertedNotes.forEach((note, index) => {
      expect(note.id).toBeGreaterThan(0);
      expect(note.title).toBe(notes[index].title);
      expect(note.content).toBe(notes[index].content);
      expect(note.isArchived).toBe(notes[index].isArchived);
    });

    // Act: Query all notes
    const allNotes = await db.select().from(notesTable);

    // Assert: Verify we can query all notes back
    expect(allNotes).toHaveLength(3);
  });

  it('should update a note', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a note
    const [note] = await db
      .insert(notesTable)
      .values({
        title: 'Original Title',
        content: 'Original Content',
        isArchived: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the note
    const [updatedNote] = await db
      .update(notesTable)
      .set({
        title: 'Updated Title',
        content: 'Updated Content',
        isArchived: true,
      })
      .where(eq(notesTable.id, note.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the note was updated
    expect(updatedNote.id).toBe(note.id);
    expect(updatedNote.title).toBe('Updated Title');
    expect(updatedNote.content).toBe('Updated Content');
    expect(updatedNote.isArchived).toBe(true);
  });

  it('should delete a note', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a note
    const [note] = await db
      .insert(notesTable)
      .values({
        title: 'Note to Delete',
        content: 'This note will be deleted',
        isArchived: false,
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Delete the note
    const deletedNotes = await db
      .delete(notesTable)
      .where(eq(notesTable.id, note.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the note was deleted
    expect(deletedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(deletedNotes[0].id).toBe(note.id);

    // Verify the note is no longer in the database
    const queriedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notesTable)
      .where(eq(notesTable.id, note.id));

    expect(queriedNotes).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  it('should filter archived and non-archived notes', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert both archived and non-archived notes
    await db.insert(notesTable).values([
      { title: 'Active Note 1', content: 'Content 1', isArchived: false },
      { title: 'Active Note 2', content: 'Content 2', isArchived: false },
      { title: 'Archived Note 1', content: 'Content 3', isArchived: true },
    ]);

    // Act: Query only non-archived notes
    const activeNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notesTable)
      .where(eq(notesTable.isArchived, false));

    // Assert: Verify filtering works
    expect(activeNotes).toHaveLength(2);
    activeNotes.forEach((note) => {
      expect(note.isArchived).toBe(false);
    });

    // Act: Query only archived notes
    const archivedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notesTable)
      .where(eq(notesTable.isArchived, true));

    // Assert: Verify filtering works
    expect(archivedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(archivedNotes[0].isArchived).toBe(true);
  });
});

- `@neondatabase/serverless` - Neon's serverless PostgreSQL driver
- `ws` - WebSocket support for Node.js
- `drizzle-kit` - CLI tool for migrations

### 🗄️ **Database Setup**
- Created a new Neon project named "notes-app" (ID: `bitter-silence-55811308`)
- Configured connection string in `.env.local`
- Created a `notes` table with the following schema:
  - `id` (serial, primary key)
  - `title` (text, required)
  - `content` (text, required)
  - `isArchived` (boolean, default false)
  - `createdAt` (timestamp, auto-generated)
  - `updatedAt` (timestamp, auto-generated)

### 📁 **Files Created**

1. **`src/schema.ts`** - Database schema definition with TypeScript types
2. **`src/db.ts`** - Database connection using Neon HTTP adapter (ideal for serverless)
3. **`drizzle.config.ts`** - Drizzle Kit configuration for migrations
4. **`__tests__/notes.integration.test.ts`** - Comprehensive integration tests

### ✅ **Integration Tests**
The test suite includes 5 comprehensive tests that all pass:
1. ✓ Add a note and query it back
2. ✓ Insert multiple notes and query them all
3. ✓ Update a note
4. ✓ Delete a note
5. ✓ Filter archived and non-archived notes

- `@neondatabase/serverless` - Neon's serverless PostgreSQL driver
- `ws` - WebSocket support for Node.js
- `drizzle-kit` - CLI tool for migrations

### 🗄️ **Database Setup**
- Created a new Neon project named "notes-app" (ID: `bitter-silence-55811308`)
- Configured connection string in `.env.local`
- Created a `notes` table with the following schema:
  - `id` (serial, primary key)
  - `title` (text, required)
  - `content` (text, required)
  - `isArchived` (boolean, default false)
  - `createdAt` (timestamp, auto-generated)
  - `updatedAt` (timestamp, auto-generated)

### 📁 **Files Created**

1. **`src/schema.ts`** - Database schema definition with TypeScript types
2. **`src/db.ts`** - Database connection using Neon HTTP adapter (ideal for serverless)
3. **`drizzle.config.ts`** - Drizzle Kit configuration for migrations
4. **`__tests__/notes.integration.test.ts`** - Comprehensive integration tests

### ✅ **Integration Tests**
The test suite includes 5 comprehensive tests that all pass:
1. ✓ Add a note and query it back
2. ✓ Insert multiple notes and query them all
3. ✓ Update a note
4. ✓ Delete a note
5. ✓ Filter archived and non-archived notes

All tests use Drizzle syntax and verify complete CRUD operations against the live Neon database. # Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

import { db } from '@/db';
import { notes } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('Notes Integration Test', () => {
  beforeEach(async () => {
    // Clean up the notes table before each test
    await db.delete(notes);
  });

  it('should add a note to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new note
    const newNote = {
      title: 'Test Note',
      content: 'This is a test note content',
    };

    // Act: Insert the note into the database
    const [insertedNote] = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values(newNote)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the note was inserted
    expect(insertedNote).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedNote.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedNote.title).toBe(newNote.title);
    expect(insertedNote.content).toBe(newNote.content);
    expect(insertedNote.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedNote.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the note back from the database
    const queriedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notes)
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    // Assert: Verify the queried note matches the inserted note
    expect(queriedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(queriedNotes[0]).toMatchObject({
      id: insertedNote.id,
      title: newNote.title,
      content: newNote.content,
    });
  });

  it('should query all notes from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create multiple notes
    const testNotes = [
      { title: 'First Note', content: 'Content of first note' },
      { title: 'Second Note', content: 'Content of second note' },
      { title: 'Third Note', content: 'Content of third note' },
    ];

    // Act: Insert multiple notes
    await db.insert(notes).values(testNotes);

    // Act: Query all notes
    const allNotes = await db.select().from(notes);

    // Assert: Verify all notes were inserted and can be queried
    expect(allNotes).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(allNotes[0].title).toBe('First Note');
    expect(allNotes[1].title).toBe('Second Note');
    expect(allNotes[2].title).toBe('Third Note');
  });

  it('should update a note in the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create and insert a note
    const [insertedNote] = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values({
        title: 'Original Title',
        content: 'Original Content',
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the note
    const [updatedNote] = await db
      .update(notes)
      .set({
        title: 'Updated Title',
        content: 'Updated Content',
      })
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the note was updated
    expect(updatedNote.title).toBe('Updated Title');
    expect(updatedNote.content).toBe('Updated Content');

    // Query back to confirm
    const [queriedNote] = await db
      .select()
      .from(notes)
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    expect(queriedNote.title).toBe('Updated Title');
    expect(queriedNote.content).toBe('Updated Content');
  });

  it('should delete a note from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create and insert a note
    const [insertedNote] = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values({
        title: 'Note to Delete',
        content: 'This note will be deleted',
      })
      .returning();

    // Act: Delete the note
    await db.delete(notes).where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    // Assert: Verify the note was deleted
    const queriedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notes)
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    expect(queriedNotes).toHaveLength(0);
  });
});

A fully functional notes application with database integration using Neon PostgreSQL, Drizzle ORM, and Next.js.

## Project Structure

```
.
├── db/
│   ├── schema.ts          # Database schema definition
│   └── index.ts           # Database connection setup
├── __tests__/
│   └── notes.integration.test.ts  # Integration tests
├── drizzle/               # Migration files
├── drizzle.config.ts      # Drizzle configuration
├── vitest.config.ts       # Test configuration
└── .env.local             # Environment variables
```

## Features

- ✅ Neon PostgreSQL database
- ✅ Drizzle ORM for type-safe database queries
- ✅ Notes CRUD operations
- ✅ Comprehensive integration tests
- ✅ TypeScript support

## Database Schema

The `notes` table includes:
- `id` - Serial primary key
- `title` - Text field for note title
- `content` - Text field for note content
- `createdAt` - Timestamp with default value
- `updatedAt` - Timestamp with default value

## Integration Tests

The test suite in `__tests__/notes.integration.test.ts` verifies:

1. **Create and Query**: Add a note to the database and query it back successfully
2. **Query All**: Retrieve multiple notes from the database
3. **Update**: Modify an existing note
4. **Delete**: Remove a note from the database

All tests use Drizzle ORM syntax for database operations.

## Running Tests

```bash
npm test
```

## Test Results

All 4 integration tests pass successfully:
- ✓ should add a note to the database and query it back successfully
- ✓ should query all notes from the database
- ✓ should update a note in the database
- ✓ should delete a note from the database

## Database Configuration

The application uses:
- **Database Driver**: `@neondatabase/serverless` with HTTP connection
- **ORM**: Drizzle ORM
- **Connection String**: Stored in `.env.local`

## Next Steps

You can extend this application by:
1. Creating API routes in `app/api/notes/` to expose REST endpoints
2. Building a frontend UI to display and manage notes
3. Adding more fields to the notes schema (tags, categories, etc.)
4. Implementing search and filtering functionality
5. Adding authentication and user-specific notes

A fully functional notes application with database integration using Neon PostgreSQL, Drizzle ORM, and Next.js.

## Project Structure

```
.
├── db/
│   ├── schema.ts          # Database schema definition
│   └── index.ts           # Database connection setup
├── __tests__/
│   └── notes.integration.test.ts  # Integration tests
├── drizzle/               # Migration files
├── drizzle.config.ts      # Drizzle configuration
├── vitest.config.ts       # Test configuration
└── .env.local             # Environment variables
```

## Features

- ✅ Neon PostgreSQL database
- ✅ Drizzle ORM for type-safe database queries
- ✅ Notes CRUD operations
- ✅ Comprehensive integration tests
- ✅ TypeScript support

## Database Schema

The `notes` table includes:
- `id` - Serial primary key
- `title` - Text field for note title
- `content` - Text field for note content
- `createdAt` - Timestamp with default value
- `updatedAt` - Timestamp with default value

## Integration Tests

The test suite in `__tests__/notes.integration.test.ts` verifies:

1. **Create and Query**: Add a note to the database and query it back successfully
2. **Query All**: Retrieve multiple notes from the database
3. **Update**: Modify an existing note
4. **Delete**: Remove a note from the database

All tests use Drizzle ORM syntax for database operations.

## Running Tests

```bash
npm test
```

## Test Results

All 4 integration tests pass successfully:
- ✓ should add a note to the database and query it back successfully
- ✓ should query all notes from the database
- ✓ should update a note in the database
- ✓ should delete a note from the database

## Database Configuration

The application uses:
- **Database Driver**: `@neondatabase/serverless` with HTTP connection
- **ORM**: Drizzle ORM
- **Connection String**: Stored in `.env.local`

## Getting Started

First, run the development server:

```bash
npm run dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

You can extend this application by:

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

  content: text('content').notNull(),
  createdAt: timestamp('created_at').notNull().defaultNow(),

});

export type Note = typeof notes.$inferSelect;
export type NewNote = typeof notes.$inferInsert;

import { db } from '@/db';
import { notes } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('Notes Integration Test', () => {
  // Clean up the notes table before each test
  beforeEach(async () => {
    await db.delete(notes);
  });

  it('should add a note to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new note object
    const newNote = {
      title: 'Test Note',
      content: 'This is a test note content',
    };

    // Act: Insert the note into the database
    const insertedNotes = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values(newNote)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the note was inserted
    expect(insertedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(insertedNotes[0]).toMatchObject({
      title: newNote.title,
      content: newNote.content,
    });
    expect(insertedNotes[0].id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedNotes[0].createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedNotes[0].updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    const insertedNoteId = insertedNotes[0].id;

    // Act: Query the note back from the database
    const queriedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notes)
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNoteId));

    // Assert: Verify the queried note matches the inserted note
    expect(queriedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(queriedNotes[0]).toEqual(insertedNotes[0]);
    expect(queriedNotes[0].title).toBe(newNote.title);
    expect(queriedNotes[0].content).toBe(newNote.content);
  });

  it('should retrieve all notes from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert multiple notes
    const testNotes = [
      { title: 'First Note', content: 'First note content' },
      { title: 'Second Note', content: 'Second note content' },
      { title: 'Third Note', content: 'Third note content' },
    ];

    await db.insert(notes).values(testNotes);

    // Act: Query all notes
    const allNotes = await db.select().from(notes);

    // Assert: Verify all notes were retrieved
    expect(allNotes).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(allNotes[0].title).toBe('First Note');
    expect(allNotes[1].title).toBe('Second Note');
    expect(allNotes[2].title).toBe('Third Note');
  });

  it('should update a note in the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a note
    const [insertedNote] = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values({ title: 'Original Title', content: 'Original Content' })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the note
    const updatedTitle = 'Updated Title';
    const updatedContent = 'Updated Content';

    const [updatedNote] = await db
      .update(notes)
      .set({ title: updatedTitle, content: updatedContent })
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the note was updated
    expect(updatedNote.title).toBe(updatedTitle);
    expect(updatedNote.content).toBe(updatedContent);
    expect(updatedNote.id).toBe(insertedNote.id);
  });

  it('should delete a note from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a note
    const [insertedNote] = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values({ title: 'To Be Deleted', content: 'Delete me' })
      .returning();

    // Act: Delete the note
    await db.delete(notes).where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    // Assert: Verify the note was deleted
    const remainingNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notes)
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    expect(remainingNotes).toHaveLength(0);
  });
});

- **Dependencies installed:**
  - `drizzle-orm` - The ORM

  - `title` - Text field (required)
  - `content` - Text field (required)
  - `createdAt` - Timestamp with automatic default
  - `updatedAt` - Timestamp with automatic default

- Set up Drizzle with Neon's HTTP driver
- Configured with schema for type safety

- `drizzle.config.ts` - Drizzle Kit configuration
- Updated `vitest.config.ts` - Added path alias support
- Updated `package.json` - Added database scripts

### 6. **Integration Test** (`__tests__/notes.integration.test.ts`)

1. ✅ **Add and query a note** - Verifies insertion and retrieval
2. ✅ **Retrieve all notes** - Tests querying multiple records
3. ✅ **Update a note** - Validates update operations
4. ✅ **Delete a note** - Confirms deletion works

# Neon Drizzle Integration

Comprehensive Drizzle ORM setup for Neon databases with guided workflows.

## When to Use This Skill

- Setting up Drizzle in a new project (Next.js, Vite, Express, etc.)
- Integrating Drizzle into an existing application
- Creating or modifying database schemas
- Troubleshooting migration issues

## Code Generation Rules

When generating TypeScript/JavaScript code:
- BEFORE generating import statements, check tsconfig.json for path aliases (compilerOptions.paths)
- If path aliases exist (e.g., "@/*": ["./src/*"]), use them (e.g., import { x } from '@/lib/utils')
- If NO path aliases exist or unsure, ALWAYS use relative imports (e.g., import { x } from '../../../lib/utils')
- Verify imports match the project's configuration
- Default to relative imports - they always work regardless of configuration

## Available Guides

Each guide is a complete, self-contained walkthrough with numbered phases:

- **`guides/new-project.md`** - Full setup from scratch (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/existing-project.md`** - Add Drizzle to running apps (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/schema-only.md`** - Schema creation and modification (see: Table of Contents)
- **`guides/troubleshooting.md`** - Debug common issues (organized by error type)

I'll automatically detect your context (package manager, framework, deployment target) and select the appropriate guide based on your request.

## Quick Examples

Tell me what you're building - I'll handle the rest:

- "Setup Drizzle for my Next.js blog on Vercel" → Auto-detects Vercel + Next.js → HTTP adapter
- "Add Drizzle to my Express API" → Auto-detects Node.js server → WebSocket adapter
- "Create a users table with auth fields" → Loads schema guide → Generates schema

## Reference Documentation

For deeper technical details (loaded on-demand):

- `references/adapters.md` - HTTP vs WebSocket decision guide
- `references/migrations.md` - Migration patterns and troubleshooting
- `references/query-patterns.md` - Example queries and best practices

## Templates & Scripts

- `templates/schema-example.ts` - Multi-table schema with relations
- `templates/drizzle-config.ts` - Configuration examples
- `scripts/generate-schema.ts` - Automated migration generation
- `scripts/run-migration.ts` - Programmatic migration runner

## Related Skills

- **neon-serverless** - Connection setup without ORM
- **neon-toolkit** - Ephemeral databases for testing
- **add-neon-docs** - Add Neon best practices to your project (run after setup)

---

## Workflow

I will:
1. Detect your project context automatically
2. Select and load the appropriate guide
3. Follow the guide's phases sequentially
4. Track progress using the guide's workflow checklist
5. Load reference files only when needed
6. Offer to add Neon best practices to your project docs

Ready to get started? Just describe what you're building!

export const notes = pgTable('notes', {

  title: text('title').notNull(),
  content: text('content').notNull(),
  createdAt: timestamp('created_at').notNull().defaultNow(),
  updatedAt: timestamp('updated_at').notNull().defaultNow(),
});

export type Note = typeof notes.$inferSelect;
export type NewNote = typeof notes.$inferInsert;

{ describe, it, expect, beforeAll, afterAll } from 'vitest';
import { db } from '@/db';
import { notes } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('Notes Integration Tests', () => {
  // Clean up before and after tests
  beforeAll(async () => {
    // Clear all notes before tests
    await db.delete(notes);
  });

  afterAll(async () => {
    // Clean up after all tests
    await db.delete(notes);
  });

  it('should add a note to the database and query it back successfully', async () => {
    // Arrange: Create a new note object
    const newNote = {
      title: 'Test Note',
      content: 'This is a test note content',
    };

    // Act: Insert the note into the database
    const insertedNotes = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values(newNote)
      .returning();

    // Assert: Check that the note was inserted
    expect(insertedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    const insertedNote = insertedNotes[0];
    expect(insertedNote.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(insertedNote.title).toBe(newNote.title);
    expect(insertedNote.content).toBe(newNote.content);
    expect(insertedNote.createdAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(insertedNote.updatedAt).toBeInstanceOf(Date);

    // Act: Query the note back from the database
    const queriedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notes)
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    // Assert: Verify the queried note matches what was inserted
    expect(queriedNotes).toHaveLength(1);
    const queriedNote = queriedNotes[0];
    expect(queriedNote.id).toBe(insertedNote.id);
    expect(queriedNote.title).toBe(newNote.title);
    expect(queriedNote.content).toBe(newNote.content);
    expect(queriedNote.createdAt).toEqual(insertedNote.createdAt);
    expect(queriedNote.updatedAt).toEqual(insertedNote.updatedAt);
  });

  it('should query all notes from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert multiple notes
    const notesToInsert = [
      { title: 'First Note', content: 'First content' },
      { title: 'Second Note', content: 'Second content' },
      { title: 'Third Note', content: 'Third content' },
    ];

    await db.insert(notes).values(notesToInsert);

    // Act: Query all notes
    const allNotes = await db.select().from(notes);

    // Assert: Check that all notes were retrieved
    expect(allNotes.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(3);

    // Verify that our inserted notes exist
    const titles = allNotes.map(note => note.title);
    expect(titles).toContain('First Note');
    expect(titles).toContain('Second Note');
    expect(titles).toContain('Third Note');
  });

  it('should update a note in the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a note
    const [insertedNote] = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values({ title: 'Original Title', content: 'Original content' })
      .returning();

    // Act: Update the note
    const updatedTitle = 'Updated Title';
    const updatedContent = 'Updated content';

    const [updatedNote] = await db
      .update(notes)
      .set({ title: updatedTitle, content: updatedContent })
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id))
      .returning();

    // Assert: Verify the update
    expect(updatedNote.id).toBe(insertedNote.id);
    expect(updatedNote.title).toBe(updatedTitle);
    expect(updatedNote.content).toBe(updatedContent);

    // Query to double-check
    const [queriedNote] = await db
      .select()
      .from(notes)
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    expect(queriedNote.title).toBe(updatedTitle);
    expect(queriedNote.content).toBe(updatedContent);
  });

  it('should delete a note from the database', async () => {
    // Arrange: Insert a note
    const [insertedNote] = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values({ title: 'To Delete', content: 'This will be deleted' })
      .returning();

    // Act: Delete the note
    await db.delete(notes).where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    // Assert: Verify the note was deleted
    const queriedNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notes)
      .where(eq(notes.id, insertedNote.id));

    expect(queriedNotes).toHaveLength(0);
  });
});

This project has been successfully set up with a complete notes application using:
- **Neon** - Serverless PostgreSQL database
- **Drizzle ORM** - Type-safe database ORM
- **Next.js 16** - React framework
- **Vitest** - Testing framework

## 🎉 Setup Complete!

All integration tests are passing (4/4 tests passed)!

## 📁 Project Structure

```
├── db/
│   ├── schema.ts          # Database schema definition
│   └── index.ts           # Database connection and Drizzle instance
├── drizzle/               # Auto-generated migration files
├── __tests__/
│   └── notes.integration.test.ts  # Integration tests for notes
├── .env.local             # Database connection string
├── drizzle.config.ts      # Drizzle Kit configuration
└── vitest.config.ts       # Test configuration with path aliases
```

## 🗄️ Database Schema

The `notes` table includes:
- `id` - Serial primary key
- `title` - Text field (required)
- `content` - Text field (required)
- `createdAt` - Timestamp with default now()
- `updatedAt` - Timestamp with default now()

## 🧪 Integration Tests

The test suite (`__tests__/notes.integration.test.ts`) covers:

1. ✅ **Adding and querying a note** - Verifies you can insert a note and retrieve it
2. ✅ **Querying all notes** - Tests bulk insert and retrieval
3. ✅ **Updating a note** - Tests updating existing notes
4. ✅ **Deleting a note** - Tests removing notes from the database

All tests use Drizzle's type-safe query syntax with operations like:
- `db.insert(notes).values(...).returning()`
- `db.select().from(notes).where(...)`
- `db.update(notes).set(...).where(...)`
- `db.delete(notes).where(...)`

## 🚀 Available Scripts

```bash
# Run development server
npm run dev

# Run all tests
npm test

# Database commands
npm run db:generate    # Generate migration files
npm run db:migrate     # Run migrations
npm run db:push        # Push schema changes directly
npm run db:studio      # Open Drizzle Studio (GUI)

# Build and production
npm run build
npm start
```

## 📝 Using the Notes Database

### Example: Inserting a note

```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { notes } from '@/db/schema';

const newNote = await db.insert(notes)
  .values({
    title: 'My Note',
    content: 'Note content here'
  })
  .returning();
```

### Example: Querying notes

```typescript
import { db } from '@/db';
import { notes } from '@/db/schema';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

// Get all notes
const allNotes = await db.select().from(notes);

// Get a specific note by ID
const note = await db.select()
  .from(notes)
  .where(eq(notes.id, 1));
```

### Example: Updating a note

```typescript
const updated = await db.update(notes)
  .set({ title: 'Updated Title' })
  .where(eq(notes.id, 1))
  .returning();
```

### Example: Deleting a note

```typescript
await db.delete(notes)
  .where(eq(notes.id, 1));
```

import { db } from '@/db';
import { notes } from '@/db/schema';
import { desc } from 'drizzle-orm';

// GET /api/notes - Retrieve all notes
export async function GET() {
  try {
    const allNotes = await db
      .select()
      .from(notes)
      .orderBy(desc(notes.createdAt));

    return NextResponse.json({ notes: allNotes }, { status: 200 });
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error fetching notes:', error);
    return NextResponse.json(
      { error: 'Failed to fetch notes' },
      { status: 500 }
    );
  }
}

// POST /api/notes - Create a new note
export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
  try {
    const body = await request.json();
    const { title, content } = body;

    // Validate input
    if (!title || !content) {
      return NextResponse.json(
        { error: 'Title and content are required' },
        { status: 400 }
      );
    }

    // Insert the note
    const [newNote] = await db
      .insert(notes)
      .values({ title, content })
      .returning();

    return NextResponse.json({ note: newNote }, { status: 201 });
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error creating note:', error);
    return NextResponse.json(
      { error: 'Failed to create note' },
      { status: 500 }
    );
  }
}
